tasks.title: üöÄ Onboarding Guide ‚Äî Set Up Mission Control
tasks.description:
Welcome to Mission Control! Follow these steps to complete your setup. Work through each subtask in order.

**Tip:** Click on a subtask to see detailed instructions. Check it off when done.

subtasks.title: 1. Enable GitHub Pages: Settings ‚Üí Pages ‚Üí Branch: main ‚Üí Save
2. Create GitHub Token: github.com/settings/tokens ‚Üí Generate (classic) ‚Üí Scope: repo
3. Connect Dashboard: Open your GitHub Pages URL ‚Üí Click 'Connect GitHub' ‚Üí Paste token
4. Install Tailscale: brew install tailscale && tailscale up
5. Enable Funnel: tailscale funnel 18789 ‚Üí Copy your URL
6. Generate Webhook Token: openssl rand -hex 32 ‚Üí Save it
7. Add GitHub Webhook: Settings ‚Üí Webhooks ‚Üí Add ‚Üí URL: https://YOUR-TAILSCALE-URL/hooks/github?token=YOUR-TOKEN
8. Test: Create a task, move to In Progress, verify MoltBot receives notification

comments.author: Mission Control
comments.text: Once all steps are complete, you can archive this guide or keep it as reference. Your setup is done when MoltBot responds to task changes!

tasks.title: üìñ User Guide ‚Äî How to Use Mission Control
tasks.description:
Learn how to use Mission Control effectively. Both you AND MoltBot can manage tasks!

**Two ways to manage tasks:**
‚Ä¢ üë§ **You** ‚Äî Use the Dashboard UI (drag & drop, buttons, forms)
‚Ä¢ ü§ñ **MoltBot** ‚Äî Uses CLI scripts or edits tasks.json directly

subtasks.title: ‚Äî THE BOARD ‚Äî
Columns: Permanent (recurring) ‚Üí Backlog ‚Üí In Progress ‚Üí Review ‚Üí Done
Drag & Drop: Move tasks between columns to change status
Click task card to open details and edit
‚Äî CREATING TASKS ‚Äî
üë§ You: Click '+' button in any column header
ü§ñ MoltBot: Edits data/tasks.json or uses CLI
‚Äî TASK DETAILS ‚Äî
Title: Short, clear name for the task
Description: Detailed instructions (Markdown supported)
Subtasks: Break work into smaller steps (checkable)
Comments: Add notes, feedback, or progress updates
Priority: High (üî¥) / Medium (üü°) / Low (üü¢)
Project: Organize tasks by project/category
‚Äî WORKFLOW WITH MOLTBOT ‚Äî
1. Create task in Backlog with clear description
2. Move to 'In Progress' ‚Üí MoltBot gets notified via webhook
3. MoltBot works on task, updates subtasks & adds comments
4. MoltBot moves to 'Review' when done
5. You review: Approve ‚Üí Done, or add feedback ‚Üí back to In Progress
‚Äî DASHBOARD FEATURES ‚Äî
üîç Search: Filter tasks by text
üìÅ Project filter: Click project buttons to filter
‚öôÔ∏è Settings: Add/edit projects
üì¶ Archive: Store completed tasks out of sight
üë• Team: See repo collaborators (if public)
üìö Docs: Built-in documentation
‚Äî MOLTBOT CAPABILITIES ‚Äî
ü§ñ Can CREATE tasks (via CLI or JSON)
ü§ñ Can UPDATE task status, subtasks, comments
ü§ñ Can MOVE tasks between columns
ü§ñ Can DELETE/archive tasks
ü§ñ Receives WEBHOOK when you move tasks to In Progress

tasks.title: üìã Survey Design & Distribution ‚Äî Peter
tasks.description:
Design and distribute the parent spelling survey to validate market demand in Singapore. Focus on systematic, data-driven approach.

**Objectives:**
- Get 50+ responses from Singapore parents with kids aged 4-7
- Validate problem existence (80%+ rate spelling as challenging)
- Test willingness to try story-based approach (60%+)
- Confirm pricing viability (40%+ willing to pay >$5/month)

**Distribution Channels:**
- WhatsApp groups (5-10 parent communities)
- Facebook groups (Singapore Parenting, MOE support)
- Personal network (10-15 parents)
- Social media (Instagram/TikTok demo videos)

**Deliverable:** Complete Google Form with analytics summary showing validation metrics

subtasks.title: Review and refine survey questions from existing template
Create Google Form with clear structure (sections 1-6)
Draft WhatsApp group promotion message
Draft Instagram/TikTok caption for social media distribution
Add story theme preference question per Elon's request
Share on 5 WhatsApp parent groups
Post on 2-3 Facebook groups
Send to 10-15 personal network parents
Create and post 1-2 demo videos for social media
Analyze responses: document key metrics (target vs actual)
Identify validation signals and risks
Write summary report with actionable insights

tasks.title: üé≠ Story Content Framework ‚Äî Elon
tasks.description:
Design the core story-based learning framework. Think big, unconventional, and memorable. Challenge traditional memorization methods.

**Challenge:** Traditional spelling apps use repetition, flashcards, and rote memorization. Kids hate it, parents get frustrated.

**Opportunity:** Story-based learning activates imagination, creates emotional connections, and builds mnemonics naturally.

**Questions to answer:**
- What makes a spelling story memorable?
- How do we scale from 10 words to 1000 words?
- Can we use AI to generate infinite personalized stories?
- What's the minimum viable story that demonstrates value?
- How do we compete with boring but effective methods?

**Deliverable:** Story framework documentation with 5 example stories demonstrating the approach

subtasks.title: Analyze what makes traditional spelling methods fail for kids
Brainstorm story elements that enhance memory (visuals, emotions, absurdity)
Design story template structure (setup ‚Üí conflict ‚Üí resolution)
Create 5 example stories for common words (CAT, DOG, BOOK, etc.)
Define scaling strategy: how to generate stories for 100+ words
Consider AI automation: can GPT generate personalized stories?
Identify MVP features vs. nice-to-have
Document framework with clear examples and guidelines

tasks.title: üèóÔ∏è MVP Feature Definition ‚Äî Collaboration
tasks.description:
Define the minimum viable product features based on survey results and story framework. Balance Peter's systematic approach with Elon's bold vision.

**Inputs:**
- Peter's survey results (what parents actually want)
- Elon's story framework (what makes the approach work)
- Technical constraints (what we can build)
- Timeline (when do we need results)

**Deliverable:** Feature specification document with:
- Core features (must-have for launch)
- Nice-to-have features (can add later)
- Technical feasibility notes
- Development timeline estimate
- Success metrics for each feature

subtasks.title: Peter: Review survey results and identify top 3 feature priorities
Elon: Review story framework and identify technical bottlenecks
Collaborate: Align on core MVP features (maximum 5 features)
Peter: Document each feature with user story format
Elon: Add technical feasibility and innovation notes
Together: Prioritize features by impact vs. effort
Document success metrics for MVP launch
Create rough development timeline

tasks.title: üìä Market Validation Strategy ‚Äî Peter
tasks.description:
Design the go-to-market strategy and validation plan. Think systematically: who, what, where, how much.

**Questions to answer:**
- Who is the early adopter? (beyond just "parents")
- How do we reach them effectively? (channels, messaging)
- What's the conversion funnel from awareness ‚Üí trial ‚Üí paid?
- How do we measure success? (metrics, benchmarks)
- What's the pricing strategy? (freemium, trial, subscription)

**Deliverable:** GTM strategy document with:
- Target persona description
- Channel strategy with estimated reach
- Conversion funnel with metrics
- Pricing model with rationale
- A/B test ideas for optimization

subtasks.title: Analyze survey responses to identify ideal early adopter
Map customer journey from problem awareness to solution adoption
Research competitor pricing and positioning
Define pricing model (freemium, trial, subscription)
Design conversion funnel with success metrics at each stage
Create A/B test hypotheses (messaging, pricing, features)
Document go-to-market strategy with timeline

tasks.title: üöÄ Scaling & Monetization Plan ‚Äî Elon
tasks.description:
Think beyond the MVP. If this works, what's the 10x version? How do we scale to 10,000 users? 100,000?

**Questions to answer:**
- What happens after Singapore? (regional expansion, global?)
- How do we handle personalization at scale? (AI, templates, crowdsourcing?)
- What's the revenue model at scale? (subscription, marketplace, licensing?)
- Can we expand beyond spelling? (math, science, languages?)
- What's the acquisition channel that scales?
- What's the 10-year vision for this company?

**Deliverable:** Scaling plan document with:
- Phased expansion roadmap (Phase 1-5)
- Revenue projections at each phase
- Technical scaling challenges and solutions
- Long-term vision statement

subtasks.title: Define expansion phases (Singapore ‚Üí Southeast Asia ‚Üí Global)
Model revenue growth at each phase (users x pricing x churn)
Identify scaling bottlenecks (content, localization, support)
Explore product expansion (math, science, language learning)
Define acquisition channels that scale beyond personal networks
Consider ecosystem plays (schools, partnerships, licensing)
Write 10-year vision statement with milestones
Document risk factors and contingency plans

tasks.title: üìù Documentation & Processes ‚Äî Peter
tasks.description:
Create systems, templates, and documentation so the project can run smoothly and scale. Make it repeatable.

**Deliverables:**
- Project documentation (overview, goals, timeline)
- Process templates (survey creation, story writing, etc.)
- Communication flows (how elon and peter coordinate)
- Knowledge base (lessons learned, best practices)
- Automation scripts (if any repetitive tasks)

**Why this matters:** Good systems prevent rework, enable onboarding, and create leverage. Build it once, use it forever.
